channel.title: Set-Theory on Akira Tanase

item.title: Quotients, Intuitively
item.description: Quotients are one of those ideas that appear everywhere. At a very crude level, a quotient is what you get when you declare some points to be the same. Formally, start with a set $X$ and an equivalence relation $\sim$ on $X$. The quotient $X / \sim$ is the set of equivalence classes $[x]$, where $$ [x] = { y \in X : y \sim x }. $$ The canonical surjection
